concept.title: Load-Balanced Transport
concept.shortdesc: For sending messages across more than one Transport

section.title: About the Load-Balanced Transport
section.p: The Load-Balanced Transport, Swift_LoadBalancedTransport does not actually send Messages itself. It is used in conjunction with any of the other Transports so that a large batch of messages can be distributed to a number of remote servers (and perhaps a local one).

It is not likely that the average Swift Mailer user will find a need for this Transport, but companies that need to send large volumes of mail and have access to several SMTP servers may opt to make use of this Transport so that the stress imposed on a single SMTP server is kept down (and theoretically mail will be sent faster – though it does not parallel process – yet!).

In the scenario that excessive amounts of mail are being sent it is possible (likely in fact) that an SMTP server will fail to respond at some point during sending due to the stress it is under. The Load-Balanced Transport tracks failures and skips dead-transports once it detects that they are no longer responding.
